intro: Galium aetnicum, commonly known as the African bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous minute seeds. Galium aetnicum is often found in grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
